div.p: No. 56M, unit 822, VPRS 3181/P inwards correspondence registers, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to bring under the favorable consideration of the City Council the desirability, that the foot-path around the ground granted to the Royal Society may be raised, the present level being on most places considerably below that finally to be adopted.

I have taken the liberty of soliciting the attention of the Municipality to this requirement, as the plantations on the ground of the society are severely suffering from the drying effect, caused as well by the rapid of flow of all humidity, as by the edges of the ground to a considerable depth being exposed to the parching influence of the sun.

Since moreover soil for raising the foot-path is at present obtainable from some excavations in the vicinity, I beg to solicit in the interest of the Royal Society the aid of the Municipality in carrying out the above improvements.
